newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani stocks end up as emergency fear ends.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani stocks end up as emergency fear ends.

text.p: Pakistani stocks rose on Thursday on fresh buying after a fear of emergency ended and are likely to open higher after the Friday-Saturday weekend, dealers said.

The Karachi Stock Exchange 100-share index ended 8.39 points, or 0.62 percent, up at 1,356.63. Advancing scrips led falling ones 111 to 94 in a turnover of 22.91 million shares compared to Wednesday's 22.93 million.
"Fortunately, rumours regarding financial emergency in the country did not come true, and hence bullish spell continued," one dealer at Ali Husain Rajabali said.
